page.title: 04Farming(cont.)
page.content: crop potatoes which sometimes cause the fields to be unready for the Autumn sowing of wheat. Fertilisers are used on a large scale,for although the peat is fertile ,elements of copper and manganese are often lacking and aplications of these minerals are sprayed over the area. Crop rotation is also practised to help reatain soil fertility.In the fertile peat not only crops grow but also weeds,so as the organic content of the soil makes herbicides difficult to develop special chemicals are used and insecticides have also been developed.Fenland farms tend to be smaller than those on the surrounding upland,being on average only 50 acres. Good profits can be made from a relatively small area.There is a variety of crops grown which include cereals,rootcrops and vegetables.
